intro: Epipactis latifolia var. dilatata, commonly known as the broadleaf helleborine, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the orchid family (Orchidaceae) and is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and striking yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its flowers are spurred at the base and are often visited by various pollinators, including bees and flies. The species is notable for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and its role in supporting local biodiversity.
